author: Ronnell Foreman
title: Sharnell Tull becomes first African American council member in Pocomoke City for District 3 - 47abc
text:
Sharnell Tull becomes first African American council member in Pocomoke City for District 3
POCOMOKE CITY, Md. – Pocomoke City Council has a new member. Sharnell Tull has called the city her home for her entire life, and is the first African American woman to serve in her district.
“You might now even have to touch the door next time, you can just breeze on through, the person underneath me or coming up, or the little black kid that sees me, they might not even have to touch the door.”
She hopes to make Pocomoke City a bustling area for businesses and fellowship. She has said her mother strived for when she was younger.
Tull hopes to make Pocomoke thrive again.
“Trying to bring people here, bring new projects here, bring new businesses here. Pocomoke used to be a bustling and busy town. I used to hear stories that Pocomoke was the town that people visited to enjoy.”
Sharnell Tull will be in office for the next 4 years.

author: FOX
title: Cherokee Nation honors three Veterans with Medal of Patriotism | News | fox23.com
text: TAHLEQUAH, Okla. — The Cherokee Nation honored three Veterans with the Medal of Patriotism during the Council of the Cherokee Nation's April meeting. Christopher Huitt and Luke Brown were recognized by Cherokee Nation Principal Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr., Deputy Chief Bryan Warner and Secretary of Veteran Affairs S. Joe Crittenden. Navy Veteran Daniel Brown was posthumously honored by the tribe. The Cherokee Nation says they recognize Cherokee service men and women for their sacrifices as a way to show the high regard in which all Veterans are held by the tribe. "It's been an honor, this really touches me deep," Huitt said. "I'm honored by our people and it's an honor that I've made our people proud." The Cherokee Nation says that Native Americans, including Cherokees, are thought to have more citizens serving per capita than any other ethnic group. "Thank you all for being here and honoring us today," Luke Brown said. "It's an honor to be able to stand in the ranks with everyone else." Daniel and Luke's mother, Tanya Brown, received the award on his behalf. "I'm the Cherokee of the family and I just appreciate you honoring my offspring and inviting us to come and honoring us in this way," she said. To learn more about the Cherokee Nation Medal of Patriotism award, click [here](https://veterans.cherokee.org/cherokee-nation-medal-of-patriotism-award/#:~:text=The%20Medal%20of%20Patriotism%20is,honorably%20discharged%20from%20the%20military.). You can nominate a Veteran who is a Cherokee Nation citizen by calling 918-772-4166.

author: @alltop
title: Russia dramatically underreporting deaths from warship attack - Alltop Viral
text: Russia dramatically underreporting deaths from warship attackPosted by [Annie May](https://alltop.com/viral/author/annie-may)/ December 28, 2023 Russia is dramatically [downplaying the number of people killed](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/russia-drastically-underplaying-toll-warship-165324562.html) in a [recent warship attack](https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-confirms-ukraine-took-out-novocherkassk-warship-black-sea-crimea-2023-12). [Alexey Navalny has been missing for more than two weeks](https://www.cnn.com/2023/12/22/europe/navalny-disappearance-putin-election-intl-hnk/index.html). [Putin quietly hints that he is open to a ceasefire with Ukraine](https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/23/world/europe/putin-russia-ukraine-war-cease-fire.html). [Russia stole nearly 8 million tons of Ukrainian harvest](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/23/russia-stole-nearly-8-million-tons-of-harvest-in-occupied-ukraine/). [Russia is preparing a major offensive as the ground freezes](https://euromaidanpress.com/2023/12/20/russia-preparing-major-offensive-in-avdiivka-as-ground-freezes-warns-white-house/). [Russian drones are allegedly dropping tear](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukrainian-troops-say-russian-drones-are-dropping-tear-gas-choking-starting-fires-2023-12) gas on Ukrainian troops on the front lines. President Zelenksy has [denied that Ukraine is losing its war against Russia](https://www.bbc.com/news/live/world-67760177?src_origin=BBCS_BBC). [Putin tells Russia that his aims with the war are unchanged](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67711802). [Putin has admitted that Russia has suffered tremendous losses in Ukraine](https://www.newsweek.com/putin-admits-russia-suffered-huge-losses-ukraine-1852660). [The US is going to issue another round of funding to Ukraine](https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/3615582/biden-administration-announces-new-security-assistance-for-ukraine/). Earlier this week, more than [100 European countries encouraged the United States](https://www.pravda.com.ua/eng/news/2023/12/11/7432632/) to offer more funding to Ukraine. [Zelensky is set to travel to Washington again](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/25285). The [White House has said the cost of not supporting Ukraine is too high](https://kyivindependent.com/white-house-costs-of-not-supporting-ukraine-too-high-to-pay/). [Aid to Ukraine has fallen](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-12-07/new-aid-to-ukraine-drops-to-lowest-level-since-war-began?leadSource=reddit_wall) to its lowest level since the war began. The [White House has warned of an urgent need to send more aid to Ukraine.](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-67585902) [Russian soldiers executed two surrendering Ukrainian soldiers](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/24977). [Russians’ support of the war is falling dramatically](https://www.euronews.com/2023/12/02/russians-support-of-ukraine-war-collapses-finds-poll), according to a recent poll. [Russia is paying off military wives to stave off criticism](https://inews.co.uk/news/world/russia-paying-off-soldiers-wives-silence-anti-war-dissent-2788669) before the next election. [Putin is pushing Russian women to have as many as 8 kids](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukraine-war-putin-urges-russians-8-kids-amid-demographic-crisis-2023-11). [Russia suffered its worst losses of the war so far](https://www.semafor.com/article/11/29/2023/ukraine-russia-war-updates-russia-suffers-worst-month-for-casualties-uk-says) this November. [Audio intercepted from Russia troops fighting in Ukraine](https://apnews.com/article/ukraine-war-russian-soldiers-intercepted-audio-d2418788051731a32689feb821cd29ec?user_email=a72137fca6de941f924bfd282515a6cd53e072240494d19ed4a1c9b8a677ff62&utm_term=Afternoon+Wire) suggest they’re getting tired of the war. [Ukraine has regained more ground](https://english.nv.ua/nation/russians-have-nothing-similar-to-surovikin-line-on-left-bank-50371231.html) in Kherson Oblast. [Ukraine is claiming to have pushed Russian forces back as far as five miles,](https://www.businessinsider.com/ukraine-pushed-russian-forces-back-2-5-miles-from-dnipro-river-banks-2023-11) which would be the first meaningful success of the counteroffensive. Zelensky has warned [Ukrainians to be prepared for intensified Russian](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/zelenskiy-tells-ukrainians-prepare-russian-winter-onslaught-2023-11-12/) attacks this winter. [Ukraine has enough energy resources](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-has-enough-energy-resources-get-through-winter-energy-minister-2023-11-12/) to make it through the winter. [Ukraine has destroyed a major Russian warship](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/23747). Ukraine has warned that, without more help from allies, it is entering a [war of attrition with Russia](https://www.cnn.com/2023/11/03/world/ukraine-president-warns-long-attritional-war/index.html). [Russia has attacked the largest number of settlements](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67283305) in one day since the beginning of the war. [Russian soldiers have been accused of killing a family of nine](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67262610) people for refusing to give up their house. [Russia’s new assault on Ukraine is causing heavy casualties](https://www.euronews.com/2023/10/27/war-in-ukraine-russia-suffering-significant-losses-in-new-offensive-white-house-says), according to the U.S. [Russia has begun a massive assault across the eastern front](https://kyivindependent.com/russia-intensifies-attacks-along-much-of-eastern-front/). There is [fierce fighting in eastern Ukraine as Russia](https://www.cnn.com/2023/10/13/europe/russia-attack-avdiivka-ukraine-intl/index.html) steps up its assaults. [Russia launched a large attack in eastern Ukraine](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67095103). Putin has claimed that [Russia successfully tested a nuclear-powered cruise missile](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67021695), which would have a potentially unlimited range. There is no proof that his claims are true. A [Russian airstrike has killed 51 people at a Ukraine funeral](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67022615). [Russia is trying to get back on the UN human rights council.](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66919358) In the latest (and most disturbing) Russian propaganda ad, [Russian soldiers say they hope to live in conquered Ukraine cities](https://www.yahoo.com/news/russian-soldiers-dream-conquering-ukrainian-032433973.html). Taiwan is complaining [China is harassing them by flying 103 planes](https://apnews.com/article/taiwan-china-flights-b8a78493341bd3af15f4fd58be692e4d) towards the island’s airspace. The [United States will give Taiwan $345 million in military](https://apnews.com/article/taiwan-military-aid-china-support-06e61a0e0ed787ea120f839ef59885fa) aid. [Taiwan is using Ukraine as a model as they prepare for possible Chinese aggression](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/jul/09/ukrainian-strategy-has-become-a-model-taiwanese-beef-up-military-to-face-china-threat). [China has simulated an attack on key Taiwanese targets](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-65223970) China’s foreign minister has [warned the United States not to cross its “red line”](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/12/23/us-must-stop-unilateral-bullying-chinas-foreign-minister-says) with “bullying” tactics. China claims it drove off a [US naval cruiser near the Spratly](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-says-it-drove-away-us-cruiser-that-illegally-intruded-waters-near-south-2022-11-29/) Islands. [China has warned of a potential arms race](https://globalnews.ca/news/9238670/china-arms-race-b52-bombers-australia/) after learning that the US was sending [nuclear-capable bombers to Australia](https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-plans-to-send-b-52-bombers-to-australia-in-effort-to-counter-china-11667268615). President Biden has said that the [United States would defend Taiwan if China invaded](https://www.dw.com/en/biden-us-forces-would-defend-taiwan-if-china-invades/a-63166248). [China has been simulating attacking United States](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-says-china-has-been-simulating-attacks-us-navy-ships-2022-09-01) ships, according to Taiwan. Taiwan [shot down a Chinese drone](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-shoots-down-unidentified-drone-kinmen-2022-09-01/); yesterday, [Taiwan fired on a Chinese drone](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-president-restraint-does-not-mean-it-wont-counter-china-2022-08-30/) that invaded its airspace.More than [50 Chinese warplanes and 6 warships](https://focustaiwan.tw/cross-strait/202208180020) have been spotted near Taiwan. [Chinese aircraft have entered Taiwanese](https://www.aninews.in/news/world/asia/17-chinese-military-aircraft-5-ships-cross-taiwan-strait-median-line20220817113038/) airspace yet again. Just two weeks ago, Taiwan scrambled jets as 22 [Chinese aircraft invade Taiwanese airspace](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/taiwan-scrambles-jets-22-chinese-fighters-cross-taiwan-strait-median-line-2022-08-03/). [Australia’s defense minister has said that China’s military buildup is the “most ambitious” since WWII](https://www.newsweek.com/china-military-buildup-most-ambitious-since-wwii-australia-warns-marles-lloyd-austin-1714923) and could endanger geopolitical stability. [China has launched an AI-piloted, unmanned naval ship capable of carrying and launching dozens of drones](https://www.businessinsider.com/china-launches-worlds-first-ai-unmanned-drone-aircraft-carrier-2022-6). [Taiwan has deployed advanced, fourth generation fighter jets in a show of force](https://thehill.com/policy/international/asia-pacific/582095-taiwan-deploys-advanced-fighter-jets-amid-tensions-with) to stand up to China. China has fifth-generation fighter jets, but so does the United States, who has backing Taiwan. [The president of Taiwan has said that the threat from China is increasing every day](https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/27/asia/tsai-ingwen-taiwan-china-interview-intl-hnk/index.html), and she has confirmed that there are US military trainers assisting the Taiwanese. Last week, [Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to achieve a “peaceful reunification” with Taiwan](https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinas-xi-says-reunification-with-taiwan-must-will-be-realised-2021-10-09/), despite the threatening presence of Chinese fighters in Taiwanese airspace over the past months. In response, the [Taiwanese president has vowed to defend Taiwan’s sovereignty](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-president-pledge-defence-sovereignty-democracy-2021-10-09/). [Biden has sided with China as tensions heat up between China and Taiwan, reiterating that the U.S. will abide by the “one China” policy](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/biden-says-he-chinas-xi-have-agreed-abide-by-taiwan-agreement-2021-10-05/)––meaning the US will follow the Chinese assertion that Taiwan is its territory. [Taiwan has recorded a record number of Chinese jets in its airspace](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-58794094). This past summer, Chinese jets entered Taiwanese airspace multiple times. In June, [China sent a massive force of 28 aircraft into Taiwanese airspace, including nuclear-capable bombers,](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-reports-largest-incursion-yet-by-chinese-air-force-2021-06-15/) the largest and most threatening show of force yet. [The Chinese government, angered by recent developments between the U.S. and Taiwan, has warned the U.S. State Department to “stop all forms” of official outreach to Taiwan](https://www.tampafp.com/china-warns-state-department-to-stop-all-forms-of-official-outreach-to-taiwan/). This might actually signal a warming of tensions, consider a few months ago [China was threatening to fly fighter jets over Taiwan if U.S.-Taiwan relations continued to warm](https://www.newsweek.com/china-fighter-jets-will-fly-over-taiwan-declare-sovereignty-state-media-says-1583109). China also threatened “all-out war” if Taiwan fires on the jets. That same time, [Taiwan reported the largest incursion by the Chinese air force yet](https://www.reuters.com/article/taiwan-china-defense/update-1-taiwan-reports-largest-incursion-yet-by-chinese-air-force-idUSL1N2M516J). [The United States said it would defend Taiwan in the face of Chinese incursions into Taiwanese airspace a few months ago](https://www.rfa.org/english/news/china/defend-04082021105404.html). [China sent more fighter jets into Taiwanese air space as a result, escalating their show of force](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-taiwan-defence/taiwan-says-will-fight-to-the-end-if-china-attacks-idUSKBN2BU0HJ). [Taiwan threatened to shoot down the Chinese drones in its airspace, if they get too close to the Taiwanese-controlled Pratas Islands](https://www.reuters.com/article/us-southchinasea-taiwan/taiwan-says-may-shoot-down-chinese-drones-in-south-china-sea-idUSKBN2BU1CV). [Chinese drones were spotted gathering intelligence around Taiwan, according to the Taiwanese coast guard](https://www.newsweek.com/chinese-drones-spotted-gathering-intel-around-taiwan-islands-1580348). [Eleven Chinese warplanes flew into Taiwanese airspace on Monday, part of China’s rising imperial aspirations](https://www.newsweek.com/chinese-warplanes-buzz-around-taiwan-pincer-movement-1579692). Earlier this month, [China, as part of its usual change-of-presidency bellicosity, warned the United States against interfering with China’s designs on Taiwan](https://www.newsweek.com/china-necessary-measures-taiwan-resolutely-defend-us-1576956). Earlier this year, [China called Taiwan an “insurmountable red line.”](https://www.dw.com/en/china-warns-us-not-to-cross-red-line-on-taiwan/a-56798946) More [news.](https://alltop.com/news)

author: Christine Muchira
title: UN agency urges ‘all possible support’ for Sudanese civilians
text: The head of the International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Wednesday appealed for the international community to provide an urgent boost in funding and commitment to address Sudan’s escalating humanitarian crisis, now entering its tenth month. A staggering six million people have been displaced within Sudan [since the war between rival militaries](https://news.un.org/en/story/2023/04/1135702) the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RAF) erupted on 15 April 2023. A further 1.7 million civilians have sought refuge across borders in South Sudan, Chad, Ethiopia, Egypt, the Central African Republic, and Libya. Their plight demands urgent global attention and an immediate ceasefire, IOM Director General Amy Pope said, having witnessed the devastating impact for herself during a recent visit to eastern Chad. “A ceasefire in Sudan is urgently needed to enable people to rebuild their lives with dignity. We must not turn our back on the suffering of millions of people affected by such devastating conflict,” she said. “Now, more than ever, we need all possible support to continue providing lifesaving humanitarian assistance and move towards recovery and long-term solutions.” Funds needed IOM has launched an appeal for $307 million in 2024 to support 1.2 million people affected by the conflict, including internally displaced individuals, refugees, returnees, and third-country nationals. The UN agency has supported over one million individuals in Sudan and neighboring countries so far, with cash assistance, facilitating safe transportation also delivering critical health, protection, water, sanitation, and hygiene support. ‘No end in sight’ The human rights expert appointed by the UN High Commissioner to monitor Sudan, echoed that call on Wednesday for an immediate end to the violence and transition to civilian rule. Radhouane Nouicer, appointed just over a year ago, demanded justice for the multiple abuses recorded so far. “As fighting between the SAF and the RSF spreads across the country, violations of human rights and international humanitarian law are continuing unabated. It is crucial that the leaders of both sides show more political will to put an end to violence and silence the guns,” he said. “In my regular meetings with Sudanese civil society representatives, I have heard horrific reports of human suffering, including hundreds of suspected cases of enforced disappearance and multiple cases of arbitrary detention by both parties to the conflict,” he added. Rise in ethnic violence Nouicer also expressed alarm at the rise in ethnically motivated violence and hate speech, particularly in the Darfur region, where the RSF and allied Arab militias have targeted the African Masalit community. Reports of conscription of children and mobilization of civilians into so-called “popular” resistance groups are also deeply concerning. In all, over 25 million civilians including over 14 million children need humanitarian assistance and protection. There have also been deeply disturbing accounts of sexual violence against women and girls, most of them allegedly perpetrated by RSF members and their allied militia. ‘This must not continue’ “Sudan a most fertile land is running out of food, and millions are facing acute hunger, but despite the enormous need, delivering aid remains extremely challenging due to ongoing hostilities, persistent insecurity, attacks on humanitarian workers and bureaucratic hurdles,” Nouicer said. At least 45 aid workers have been killed or detained since the start of the conflict – almost all Sudanese nationals. Fuel shortages also continue to affect the movement of humanitarian staff and supplies and the generation of power needed for operations, such as maintaining cold chain storage and running water pumps. “This must not continue. The Government of Sudan, which has the primary responsibility to protect civilians, must take concrete steps to ensure sufficient aid can reach all those in need and facilitate the access of humanitarian convoys to the populations affected by the conflict,” stressed the expert.

author: Submitted by
title: Use the extra day to boost your health | Department of Public Health & Environment
text: REMOTE (February 29, 2024): It’s four years in the making! Leap Day is here. What will you do with the extra day? The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has some ideas: There’s no time like the present! Use your bonus day by making a health-conscious splash. Whether it's finally making an appointment for that overdue check-up, [getting up-to-date on recommended vaccines](/immunizations/get-vaccinated), or simply indulging in some well-deserved self-care, investing in your well-being is always a good idea! Radon? Not on our watch! Home is where the heart is, but it's also where radon might be lurking. Put the odds in your favor by testing your home for radon. Worried about the cost? Fear not! Find out how to [access a discounted radon test kit](/hm/testing-your-home-radon) to keep your home safe from lung cancer risks. Maximize health and financial well-being: File early for tax benefits! Why wait? Get a jump on your tax returns early and effortlessly at [GetAheadColorado.org](https://www.getaheadcolorado.org/) where you can file securely and for free. Plus, don't miss out on potential cashback from the Child Tax Credit and the Earned Income Tax Credit — file now to claim your benefits and seize the day! A breath of fresh air! Whether it's a brisk walk, a jog in the park, or a fun outdoor activity, embrace the opportunity to get active and enjoy the fresh Colorado air. Living an active lifestyle is just one way you can [protect your heart health](https://www.livetothebeat.org/) and [support a healthy brain](/adrd)! E-bike extravaganza! Ditch the car keys and hop on the eco-friendly bandwagon. Ride a bike, take a walk, or use public transportation to reduce environmental impacts and protect clean Colorado air. Household motor vehicle trips are one of the biggest drivers of transportation emissions in the country. Find out how to [access an E-bike](https://energyoffice.colorado.gov/transportation/e-bikes). Farm-to-fork fiesta! Time to play chef with some homegrown Colorado produce. Whip up a scrumptious and [healthy meal](/health/prevention-and-wellness/healthy-eating-and-active-living) while brushing up on [food safety best practices](/press-release/cdphe-highlights-food-safety-tips-to-protect-coloradans-during-the-holidays). Hydration celebration! Dive into the refreshing embrace of Colorado water. Discover inventive ways to [boost your daily water intake and stay hydrated](https://www.cdc.gov/healthyweight/healthy_eating/water-and-healthier-drinks.html#Benefits) — your body will thank you. (Early) Spring clean! Clear out the clutter by dropping off old or unused meds at a [Medication Takeback drop box](/colorado-medication-take-back-program). It's not just a cleanup. It's a safeguard against accidents and misuse, and keeping our water systems pristine. Information is power! Explore the universe of CDPHE's [information campaigns](/marketing-campaigns) dedicated to preserving public and environmental health. We've got your back, Colorado! Join us at the table! Get your voice heard and make a difference! Dive into [public meetings on environmental justice](/community-engagement-outreach-and-public-participation-best-practices), where you can weigh in on issues close to your heart. Because your opinion matters, and we're all ears. Leap Day just got a whole lot cooler, thanks to CDPHE's health-packed, joy-filled playbook. Get ready to make the most of those bonus 24 hours, Colorado-style! ###

organizations.name: colorado department of public health and environment

author: Haqqin.az
title: Еще одна европейская страна призвала к санкциям против израильтян
text:
Глава МИД Швеции Мария Малмер Стенергард призвала ЕС ввести санкции против крайне правых израильских министров, следуя примеру Великобритании и других западных союзников. В интервью Politico она заявила о необходимости ограничений против отдельных экстремистски настроенных членов кабинета премьер-министра Израиля Биньямина Нетаньяху.
После встречи с главой европейской дипломатии Кайей Каллас Стенергард подчеркнула, что Швеция будет настаивать на санкциях против таких министров, добавив: «Я хочу подчеркнуть, что мы настоящие друзья израильского народа, но по-прежнему наша обязанность — оказать давление на израильское правительство».
Для введения санкций ЕС требуется единогласная поддержка всех 27 стран-членов, что, по мнению Politico, маловероятно из-за противодействия сторонников Израиля, таких как Венгрия.
11 июня 2025 года Австралия, Канада, Новая Зеландия, Норвегия и Великобритания ввели санкции против министра национальной безопасности Израиля Итамара Бен-Гвира и министра финансов Бецалеля Смотрича за подстрекательство к насилию против палестинцев на Западном берегу.

author: @WAFB
title: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car
text: Retired police sergeant on vacation with family rescues couple from sinking car CINCINNATI ( [WXIX](https://www.fox19.com/2024/06/21/retired-cpd-sergeant-family-rescue-unknown-tri-state-couple-during-florida-vacation/)/Gray News) - A retired Cincinnati police sergeant and his family saved an Ohio couple who just happened to be vacationing in the same area in Florida. The Ramsey family is from Ohio, while the Bell family lives in northern Kentucky. Up until June 11, the two families had no idea they lived so close to one another. Some might call it a coincidence. Others will say it’s luck, but these two families call it a miracle. Dean and Shana Ramsey recall the moment they said they almost drowned while vacationing in Siesta Key, Florida. Several streets flooded that day after the area received more than 11 inches of rain, an abnormal amount, according to Sarasota County officials. “You couldn’t see anything but rain and water,” Dean Ramsey recalled. With several cars stalled on the road, the couple said they tried to pull off on what they thought was land. “The water sucked us right into that lagoon and that was it,” Dean Ramsey explained. Watching in horror from their condo was retired Cincinnati Police Department sergeant Mike Bell, his wife Ginger Bell and their three young kids. The Bell family responded. “We were able to stop, slow things down, and assess and make some decisions on how we were going to move forward,” Mike Bell said. That plan started with Mackenzie Bell giving valuable information to 911. “I remembered they needed to know the address, so that’s the first thing I told her and then I told her a car is in the pond and there was two people in there,” Mike’s and Ginger Bell’s daughter, Mackenzie Bell, said. Meanwhile, the retired sergeant and his wife, who is an emergency medical doctor, took action. “I went over to the edge of the water and realized it wasn’t sinking immediately, so I have a few minutes,” Mike Bell recounted from that moment. “At that time, Ginger exited the front door next to the pond. I look at her and said, ‘We need flotation devices.’” That’s where little Hank Bell came in. “I didn’t want them to die, so I ran as fast as I could,” Hank Bell explained. “I went up the elevator, which is extremely slow, and I knew there were stairs that were faster. So, I ran down the stairs.” Flotation devices in hand, the Bell kids handed them to their parents who were already in the water. “He went into the lady’s side and I went into the man’s side,” Ginger Bell said. “She was able to climb out on her own, but I put the boogie board right in front of her. She got her body on the boogie board and that’s when I started paddling and we kicked over to the side.” Ginger Bell ran into some issues helping Dean Ramsey. “When he was trying to get out, his foot got stuck, so he was on his back with one foot out and one foot stuck in the steering wheel,” Ginger Bell remembered. “I looked at her and I said, ‘I’m stuck, I can’t,’” Dean Ramsey remembered. “At that time, I was like, ‘I’m going down with the car,’ but she’s like, ‘Get out of this car! You got to get out! Kick your leg!’ I started thrashing my leg and my foot popped out.” The rescue took about five minutes. Back on dry land, the Ramsey family saw their rescuers as “guardian angels.” The families say they have plans to reunite in the near future. The Bell family wants to remind residents to always be mindful of their surroundings and assess a situation before getting involved. They said if your car is going in a body of water, roll down the windows or punch them out by hitting the corners. Those tactics could save a life. Copyright 2024 WXIX via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: At The Present Time
title: While the U.S. government has banned the sale of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) chips to Chin.. - MK
text:
Citing multiple sources, Reuters reported on the 13th (local time) that the U.S. is secretly planting location tracking devices in cargo to prevent the smuggling of AI chips shipped overseas into China. It has even introduced an unusual method to capture the flow of advanced AI chips into areas subject to U.S. export regulations.
After the investigation by the U.S. authorities, the location tracking device will be attached only to certain cargoes. Reuters evaluated, "It shows how intense the U.S. is to enforce chip export regulations."
According to sources, the installation of the location tracking device is mainly involved by the U.S. Department of Commerce's Bureau of Industrial Security (BIS). The Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) are also participating. It is a pan-governmental move to prevent the flow of advanced U.S. AI chips into China. U.S. authorities are using the information obtained by the tracker to prosecute companies and individuals who violate export controls. However, it has not been confirmed when the U.S. authorities began wearing location trackers after the implementation of export controls for advanced AI chips to China in 2022.
In industrial sites, location tracking devices are said to be used as open secrets. Reuters reported that five officials involved in the supply chain of AI servers knew that location tracking devices were installed in server cargo manufactured by Dell and Super Microcomputer. The server includes chips manufactured by Nvidia and AMD.
There were also detailed testimonies. Some officials told Reuters that last year, among the Dell server cargoes containing Nvidia chips, there were cases where the server itself had a small location tracker as well as delivery boxes and internal packaging. It is also reported that resellers remove location tracking devices from Dell and super microcomputer servers to divert advanced AI chips. The server and chip manufacturers mentioned did not say they did not know about the existence of the location tracking device or made any special comments. However, Nvidia told Reuters, "We do not install secret tracking devices on our products."
The war of nerves between the United States and China over the import and export of AI chips is currently ongoing. Earlier last month, the U.S. Donald Trump administration and Congress drew backlash from China when they mentioned asking their companies to install a location check function on AI chips being exported. In addition, on the 31st of the same month, China's National Internet Information Office (CAC) raised concerns about Nvidia's "H20" chip, which is allowed to be sold in China, and demanded that the company submit evidence.
[Reporter Choi Hyunjae]
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Ryan Burks
title: Brusdar Graterol melts hearts with daughter Aria's adorable interaction with Santa Claus, drops birthday wish for wife Allison's big day
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Follow Us Share 0 Discuss 0 Discuss What's your opinion? Brusdar Graterol melts hearts with daughter Aria's adorable interaction with Santa Claus, drops birthday wish for wife Allison's big day Discuss Now Brusdar Graterol melts hearts with daughter Aria's adorable interaction with Santa Claus, drops birthday wish for wife Allison's big day (Image source: Imagn) Brusdar Graterol had a busy 2024 Major League Baseball season as he played a key role in helping the Los Angeles Dodgers win the World Series. Brusdar had his wife, Allison, and daughter, Aria, with him for much of the celebration, and the family is together once again. In keeping with the Christmas theme, Brusdar posted a couple of photos on his Instagram story on Wednesday.
Graterol Daughter w/ Santa (Credits: Instagram/@brusdar14graterol) Brusdar was the one who photographed the meeting with Santa on Christmas Day. Allison is holding Aria as Santa Claus is reaching out for a 'high five' from the toddler. There is no caption posted.
Trending •
70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now Allison Graterol (Credits: Instagram/@brusdar14graterol) Christmas wasn't the only thing being celebrated on Dec. 25 in the Graterol household, as it was also Allison's 27th birthday. Brusdar also shared a photo of him and his wife, all dressed up for the holidays, standing in front of a Christmas tree. In an earlier post that was shared on the Instagram story, Brusdar captioned a photo with:
"Happy Birthday my love." Brusdar Graterol enjoying moments with family Brusdar Graterol is all business on the mound, posting a 2.45 ERA as a setup man with the Dodgers. He is an imposing figure on the mound in the National League, but some recent Instagram stories show that he is also willing to have fun with his young family.
On Dec. 3, Graterol was imitating Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson's character from Moana, and his long hair was a perfect fit. His daughter, Aria, was all smiles in the photos that day as she got to see her father having some fun with her.
The Los Angeles Dodgers won the 2024 World Series, and they will remain one of the top betting favorites to get it done again in 2025. Graterol is going to play a key role next season.

author: Andrés Tudares
title: Sumar afirma que Errejón reconoció “hechos moralmente reprobables” tras la denuncia anónima
text:
Sumar afirma que Errejón reconoció “hechos moralmente reprobables” tras la denuncia anónima
El exdiputado y portavoz de Sumar en el Congreso de los Diputados, Íñigo Errejón, presentó este jueves su dimisión tras la publicación de varias denuncias anónimas en redes sociales que lo acusaban de comportamientos machistas y acoso sexual. El político madrileño ha renunciado tanto a su escaño como a su puesto en la ejecutiva de la coalición, lo que ha desencadenado una rápida reacción de la formación liderada por Yolanda Díaz, que ha abierto una investigación interna para esclarecer los hechos.
El caso comenzó a hacerse público el pasado martes, cuando la periodista Cristina Fallarás compartió en Instagram una denuncia anónima que describía a un “político muy conocido de Madrid” como un “maltratador psicológico” y un “verdadero monstruo”. Aunque el mensaje no mencionaba explícitamente a Errejón, en el seno de Sumar muchos identificaron al exdiputado como el destinatario de estas graves acusaciones, lo que encendió las alarmas dentro del partido.
Según ha explicado Elizabeth Duval, secretaria de Comunicación de Sumar, el partido actuó de inmediato al conocer las acusaciones. “El martes por la mañana recibimos el anónimo de Cristina Fallarás, y desde ese momento iniciamos una investigación interna”, declaró Duval en una entrevista en el programa Hora 25. Durante el proceso, Errejón fue confrontado con las denuncias y, según la portavoz, reconoció haber tenido “comportamientos moralmente reprobables”, lo que llevó a la formación a solicitar su dimisión.
Duval también subrayó que el comportamiento admitido por Errejón no es compatible con los valores feministas que defiende Sumar. “Él reconoció unos hechos que son moralmente reprobables, unos hechos que en ningún caso cumplen con el estándar de ejemplaridad feminista que se le debe exigir a cualquier político a cualquier cargo público, pero particularmente a un cargo político de izquierdas y es por eso también por lo que quisiéramos explicaciones. Los comportamientos eran intolerables y no quedaba otra opción”, afirmó Duval, quien reiteró que el partido seguirá investigando si existen más casos de este tipo.
Los cargos de Sumar censuran el comportamiento
La noticia de la dimisión de Errejón ha provocado una ola de reacciones en el ámbito político. Yolanda Díaz, vicepresidenta segunda del Gobierno y líder de Sumar, se pronunció desde Bogotá, donde se encontraba en una visita oficial, afirmando que la decisión de apartar a Errejón fue resultado del proceso de investigación abierto dentro del partido. “Nuestro compromiso contra el machismo y por una sociedad feminista es firme y sin excepciones”, aseguró Díaz en un comunicado difundido en la red social X (antes Twitter).
Por su parte, otros miembros destacados de la coalición también han manifestado su apoyo a la dimisión de Errejón. El ministro de Cultura, Ernest Urtasun, escribió en sus redes que la coherencia entre lo que se dice y lo que se hace es una “exigencia ineludible” para los partidos progresistas. Mientras tanto, la portavoz de Más Madrid en la Asamblea, Manuela Bergerot, calificó los comportamientos reconocidos como “intolerables”.
La controversia se intensificó el jueves por la tarde cuando la actriz y presentadora Elisa Mouliaá hizo pública su denuncia de acoso sexual contra Errejón a través de sus redes sociales. “Yo soy víctima de acoso sexual por parte de Íñigo Errejón y quiero denunciarlo”, escribió Mouliaá, convirtiéndose en la primera mujer en alzar la voz de manera pública sobre el caso.
Con la dimisión de Errejón, Sumar enfrenta ahora una complicada gestión interna para esclarecer las acusaciones y proteger la credibilidad de su proyecto político, basado en principios de justicia social y feminismo. Mientras avanza la investigación, el partido ha manifestado su compromiso de escuchar y apoyar a las víctimas y garantizar que situaciones de este tipo no vuelvan a repetirse en su seno. @mundiario
